title: NFL 2019: Sophie Turner Game of Thrones, Oakland Raiders, Mason Rudolph scary hit, Patrick Mahomes
text:
NFL: Catch all the results from Week 5 in the NFL.

The Oakland Raiders won a 24-21 thriller against the Chicago Bears at the NFL’s first game at the Tottenham Hotspur’s new stadium worth a reported $A1.8 billion (£1 billion).

The Raiders ran out to a 17-0 lead at halftime before the Bears hit back late to lead the game 21-17.

The Raiders hit back in the last two minutes to snatch the game.

But it wasn’t the last win the Raiders would have on the day, winning the internet with a savage burn on Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner.

Turner brought some star power to the game, turning out in a Bears jersey, which she revealed pre-match.

“Hello every, I’m here at the Tottenham Hotspurs Stadium for the Bears-Raiders game and I’m so excited. I’m repping the Bears — bye,” Turner said in a message for social media before the game.

The Bears knew she was on their side as well.

WE BEND THE KNEE! pic.twitter.com/PMaxpSEVtF — Chicago Bears (@ChicagoBears) October 6, 2019

But despite the support of the Queen of the North the Bears couldn’t summon the victory.

The Raiders didn’t let her forget that she chose wrong, trolling the 23-year-old star with a brutal burn.

That game had a better finish than Thrones. #RaiderNation https://t.co/jvxCdHUC92 — Oakland Raiders (@Raiders) October 6, 2019

While the result was important for both teams as it pushed the Raiders to 3-2 in the AFC West, just one game down on the Kansas City Chiefs, while dropping the Bears behind the Detroit Lions into third in the NFC North, the stadium was the big winner.

Players were raving about the stadium with Oakland quarterback Derek Carr admitting the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium is “possibly the best he’s played in”.

“Everything about it is first class, the detail’s in every room,” said Carr.

“This is one of the best stadiums I’ve ever played in my life — if not the best.”

The NFL has been waiting four years to play a game at the stadium which was meant to be completed in 2018 with the NFL revealing in 2015 they would play two games a season at the stadium over the 10 years.

Bears coach Matt Nagy was blown away by the stadium.

“Absolutely gorgeous,” he said. “You walk in here and you just see it is state of the art, top notch. It blows you away — phenomenal, absolutely phenomenal.”

‘DEVASTATING’: BIZARRE SCENES AFTER SCARY HIT

Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback Mason Rudolph was left concussed after a brutal hit in their game against the Baltimore Ravens.

Rudolph was hit in the face mask by safety Earl Thomas and was left limp on the ground for several minutes.

As he was helped to his feet, the Steelers star was then bizarrely helped from the field, rather than the medicab coming to get him as it had broken down.

Lowlight of cart breaking down so Mason Rudolph has to be carried off with a concussion #steelers pic.twitter.com/KCO82uXsao — Sports Gifs & Videos (@Supreme_gifs) October 6, 2019

It was a serious moment that left teammate JuJu Smith-Schuster “praying to God that he gets up”.

Nothing easy about seeing your teammate going down, and you could tell Mason Rudolph's injury really struck JuJu Smith-Schuster deep (@TeamJuJu). #HereWeGo



"I was praying to God that he gets up, he's our quarterback, he's our guy. pic.twitter.com/DIlrUKIqRS — Jack Wascher (@JackWascher) October 7, 2019

The NFL then released a statement that the cart wasn’t needed, despite the player being left limp on the ground.

“A cart was brought on the field in the event it was needed. After evaluating the player, medical staff determined a cart was not necessary in this instance. Had one been needed, there was a backup cart on the other sideline which was immediately available. He received appropriate medical care per game day protocols, and is now in the concussion protocol.”

Post-match, Thomas said it definitely wasn’t intentional.

“I hit the strike zone like we talk about. I didn’t go high,” Thomas said. “I didn’t intentionally try to hurt him. I’m worried about him. I heard he’s at the hospital. My prayers go out to him and his family. I’ve never tried to hurt anybody.”

Rudolph was discharged from hospital that night.

To add more pain on the Steelers’ day, Pittsburgh lost 26-23 in overtime.

MAHOMES ADDS TO LEGEND

Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes is on track to be one of the all-time greats, passing yet another record despite a horror day.

Mahomes suffered an ankle injury in the first half as the Chiefs lost to the Indianapolis Colts 19-13.

Mahomes only threw for one touchdown pass and had by far his worst game — having never been held for less than 26 points in a game.

But that didn’t matter as Mahomes became the fastest player to 7000 passing yards, beating the previous record by three games.

And that puts him in good stead as the record was held by Hall of Famer Kurt Warner.

.@PatrickMahomes reached 7,000 passing yards in only his 22nd career game.



He is the fastest player to that milestone in the Super Bowl era, with the next-fastest — Hall of Famer @kurt13warner — getting there in his 25th game.@Chiefs | #SundayNightFootball — NFL Research (@NFLResearch) October 7, 2019

Already the reigning MVP, Mahomes just keeps setting new milestones and even though he only threw one TD pass, it’s was a pretty special one.

Not bad on one foot.

It was a bad day for the star, who was sacked four times and hit plenty more.

At one point in the second half, Cam Erving was pushed so far into Mahomes’ face that the backup left tackle stepped on his quarterback’s ankle, leaving Mahomes to hobble to the sideline when Kansas City was forced to punt.

“In this league, the margin of error is tiny,” Mahomes said. “If you’re not executing at a high level you’re going to lose.”

— with AP
